legal_issues: Good faith obligations in insolvency proceedings
outcome_details: The motion to extend the stay of proceedings granted by the initial order was dismissed. The motion made by ACM Advisors Ltd., and supported by other banks, for the appointment of a receiver was granted.
decision_factors: Concerns over dated appraisals and asset values
Opposition by majority of secured creditors
cited_cases: General Chemical Canada Ltd. (Re), 2005 CanLII 1079 (ON SC)
Bank of Nova Scotia v. Freure Village on Clair Creek, 1996 CanLII 8258 (ON SC)
Romspen Investment Corporation v. 6711162 Canada Inc., 2014 ONSC 2781
BCIMC Construction Fund Corporation v. The Clover on Yonge Inc., 2020 ONSC 1953
summary: The court declined the extension of CCAA protection due to a lack of confidence in Ashcroft Homes' management and various concerns raised by secured creditors. A receivership was favored to manage the restructuring process, aligning with creditorsâ€™ interests and existing security arrangements. Other potential structuring routes were not taken due to procedural issues and opposition from creditors.
